network

Class Flow<T extends Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Flow<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Node<? extends T>>

    public final class Flow<T extends Message>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Node<? extends T>>
    Represents a sequence of hops between a source and a destination.
    Author:
    Bitidork

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Flow(java.util.AbstractSequentialList<Node<? extends T>> sequence, int requiredCapacity)
      Constructs a flow along the given sequence of nodes requiring the supplied capacity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Flow

        public Flow(java.util.AbstractSequentialList<Node<? extends T>> sequence,
    int requiredCapacity)
        Constructs a flow along the given sequence of nodes requiring the supplied capacity.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence of nodes of this flow, starting with the source and ending with the destination.
        requiredCapacity - The number of messages sent along this flow per frame.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sequence is empty or requiredCapacity is not positive
